medium: Bronze with cloisonné enamel and gilt
title: Box in the Form of Books and Scrolls
description: Set of six cloisonné boxes in the form of two bundles of books; resting on a stand and surmounted by three picture scrolls, symbolizing learning or literature and painting. Background of enamel work sky blue, known as King-tai Lan blue of King Tai period because it was first produced in this period (1450-56) of Ming Dynasty. Included in the design are rosettes, floral patterns, lotus, and the meander. The three picture scrolls, two side by side and one on top, are tied by a silk scarf wrought in gold. Blackwood stand inlaid with enamelled copper plaque.
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Augustus L. Searle
